title: So, Supports are going to carry hard in season 7?

Will be a very busy night... ] It's pre-season time on the PBE! Today's PBE patch starts the 6.22 PBE cycle and is packed with pre-season changes - assassin class update, jungle changes, new items, and more!

body:
http://imgur.com/Sjz3a0e

Seriously, that 10% Max health true damage? With the heal? Whichever team gets this first and has a major team fight just wins.

replies.body:
# That thing can be used WHILE YOU'RE DEAD?

What the actual fuck?
I mean 2.5 seconds isn't exactly a short time especially if it's got the size of about a leona ult.
But you combine it with something like a Leona or Sona ult and it's just godlike.

If you can't escape the aura within 2.5 seconds then you deserve to get hit by it- if you get locked down by CC and then hit by it, then you've just been outplayed.

That said the damage really isn't even all that crazy. Anyone that's not building tank is only going to have around 3000 health by endgame. 10% of that is 300 damage... how amazing. That's equivalent to maybe 1 auto-attack from a fed adc?

depends on how big the area actually is

IF it is panth ult AoE size then this might be a problem sense most forms of CC will slow a lot of champ enough to make sure they can't get out.

If it is anivia ult size not such much.

They should.

Maybe now us supports will get some respect around here!

In all seriousness giving them more tools to protect their carries is welcome.

or just play a actual good support that can now use Soraka ult, Making Soraka even more useless.
What if your entire team buys one of these?
Im actually hyped af that it can be used while dead, boring af to sit there while dead and do nothing. All im saying is .... SION BUFF?

2 minute cooldown is kind of a big deal.

I mean I don't see why not, everyone should get a chance to hard carry.

Supp and Assa meta inc. mages will be totally out of the picture since new Assa reworks and new Assa item.

As an Aurelion Sol and Xerath main I think I'm not stepping into the game for a long while.
best bet it be anivia size or leona unit size
10% of a person's health isn't a really big amount actually, when you think about it.

2.5 seconds delay. the damage portion will probably never become relevant. the heal seems pretty strong.

im personally more excited about the possibility of knights vow making double bruiser lanes viable again. i think mage carries should get some consideration for duo lanes too, but its a step into the right direction.
